byline.original: By ROBERT H. TILLMAN and HENRY N. PONTELL

abstract: Op-Ed article by professors Robert H Tillman and Henry N Pontell asserts authorities should use same approach to deterring corporate criminals as they do with street criminals; argues effective deterrents would include increasing likelihood corporate fraud will be punished, raising possibility of jail time, not just fines, for executives and establishing stronger regulatory presence.
snippet: Volkswagen cheated on emissions tests because the chances of getting caught were low. Let’s change the calculus of corporate crime.
lead_paragraph: Volkswagen cheated on emissions tests because the chances of getting caught were low. Let’s change the calculus of corporate crime.
